turns.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
turns.text: But now... they are all one with the Borg.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: I am unlike any lifeform you have encountered before. As an android, I am in complete control of my neural net. The information contained there cannot be forcibly removed.

turns.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
turns.text: You are an imperfect being... created by an imperfect being. Finding your weakness is only a matter of time.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
turns.text: I am the Borg.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: That is a contradiction. The Borg act as a collective consciousness. There are no individuals.

turns.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
turns.text: I am the beginning... the end. I am the one who is many. I am the Borg.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: The planet's surface is covered with Borg technology.  So is the moon... and three other planets in this solar system.

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: But how?

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: Did you know her?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Not very well. We met shortly after the Enterprise-E was commissioned. I found her to be a most... promising officer.

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: Data... are you sure you're all right?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: I am still having difficulty integrating certain emotions into my programming. Grief, loss, remorse...

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: We still have to make reports on ten more crewmen killed in action. Maybe you should deactivate your emotion chip until we're done.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: No. Human beings do not have that luxury, and neither should I.

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: I will admit... there are times when I wish I had an emotion chip I could turn on and off.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: "APR cell count?" What the hell are you talking about?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Doctor Crusher has been... studying some advanced medical theories.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Juice?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Power. There hasn't been a lot of wind through here for the last couple of weeks. Most of the batteries are depleted.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Where's the battery room for the hospital?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I told you, there's no --

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Outside, around back. Next to the water tank.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: What did you do to the batteries?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Oh... just a little tinkering. How is he?

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Captain, I'm starting to worry about the hull integrity. We've been running the support field at full power for three hours straight. I don't know how much longer it's going to hold up.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Understood. Keep me informed.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: I have the silo, sir. Bearing three one zero... distance, three hundred meters.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Let's go.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: This must be it.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: How serious is the damage?

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: I'm having trouble scanning underground. There's a lot of radiation leaking from something.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Probably from the nuclear warhead. Cochrane was planning to use it to ignite the warp drive.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: I'm picking up faint life signs twenty meters below.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: There should be an access hatch nearby...

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Alphanumeric lock. We need a password to get in...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I have the password right here.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Blast door. It's designed to protect the control room when the missile is launched.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: There should be some kind of manual release...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Picard to Enterprise.  Enterprise, please respond.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: It could be the radiation, Captain. Try from the surface.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: This used to be the throttle valve assembly.  It controls the thrust of the engines. It's been completely vaporized... and without it, there's no way to launch the ship.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Can you reconstruct the throttle valve?

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Yeah... if I knew what it looked like. There's probably five hundred ways to design a valve like this...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: We need to launch this ship in under eighteen hours...  There must be some design schematics... blueprints...

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: We're tearing this place apart looking for them... but the computers are down, and the fires destroyed half the files...so far, nothing.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Maybe...  Sure. Yeah. As long as I could get a clear look at the intake configuration. But so far, we haven't found any other photos.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: If there are other photographs... I think I may know how to find them.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Where's you get the alloy for the throttle itself?

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: They used copper pipes in their plumbing... so I melted it down... and fused it with some tritanium from one of our phaser casings.  It's not the strongest alloy... but it's better than all this crude aluminum and steel.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Ready to make a little history?

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Always am.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Phoenix to control.  Initiating five minute countdown... mark.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: We can't leave her out there. When the ship launches... she'll be killed.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Tell her to go back to Resurrection.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: She's a very... determined woman.  Phoenix to control. Mister Lange... let her in.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Captain --

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: This is Picard. I've suspended the launch sequence.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Captain... we've got less than ten minutes before that Vulcan ship leaves the system. We've got to go <U>now</U>.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: It'll have to wait. Come on.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: No... the door's too thick.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Then we'll just have to assume it's still there...

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: What's still there?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Get a tricorder. You're going to have to track my exact position in that room...

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Solid rocket fuel at twenty-five thousand kilograms...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Altitude fifty kilometers...

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Entering the upper ionospere...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: There's a red light on the second intake valve.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Ignore it. We'll be fine.  Prepare for first stage shut-down and separation on my mark...

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Ready to deploy the warp nacelles.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: As they used to say... all systems are go.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: The Vulcans should be out there right now. We need to break the warp barrier in the next five minutes if we're going to get their attention.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Bring the warp core on-line. I'll lay in a heading.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: The nacelles are charged... nuclear warhead standing by. We're ready to ignite the warp drive.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: <U>Engage.</U>

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Passing one-half light speed. The starboard nacelle's running a little hot...

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: I'm on it...

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: The inertial dampers are having trouble compensating... I don't think Cochrane built this thing for comfort.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Speed -- two hundred, seventy-five thousand kilometers per second.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: There's no temporal shielding in here! We're starting to pick up relativistic effects!

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: One minute to warp threshold...

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Captain, the Enterprise!

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Picard to Enterprise.  Picard to Enterprise -- do you read me?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Their com system must still be down.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: Well, I feel a whole lot better with them out there. We may need some help.

turns.speaker: GEORDI
turns.text: They're getting awfully close... what the hell are they doing?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: We're crossing the threshold!

turns.speaker: PICARD'S VOICE
turns.text: Are we on schedule? The Vulcan ship will be here in less than two hours.

turns.speaker: GEORDI'S VOICE
turns.text: It'll be tight, but we should make it.

turns.speaker: PICARD'S VOICE
turns.text: What about our warp signature? It has to be strong enough for them to detect.

turns.speaker: GEORDI'S VOICE
turns.text: I've enhanced the plasma injectors -- don't worry, they'll see it.

turns.speaker: PICARD'S VOICE
turns.text: Well, with any luck... the Vulcans will land outside Resurrection tomorrow morning... and Earth will never be the same again.

turns.speaker: GEORDI'S VOICE
turns.text: ATR setting...

turns.speaker: PICARD'S VOICE
turns.text: Active.

turns.speaker: GEORDI'S VOICE
turns.text: Main bus...

turns.speaker: PICARD'S VOICE
turns.text: Ready.

turns.speaker: GEORDI'S VOICE
turns.text: Initiate pre-ignition sequence.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Oh...  yes... ultraviolet protection. Thank you. Mister...?

turns.speaker: SCRIMM
turns.text: Lieutenant, actually. Lieutenant Jonathan Scrimm. I'm the head of the Resurrection Protective Force.  And you are?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Jean-Luc Picard.

turns.speaker: SCRIMM
turns.text: Great name. French?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SCRIMM
turns.text: You don't sound French.

turns.speaker: SCRIMM
turns.text: Where in the States?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Oh... here and there. You know how it is.

turns.speaker: SCRIMM
turns.text: Not really. I was born and raised right here. Never had much use for travel.

turns.speaker: SCRIMM
turns.text: Where are you from most recently?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: California. San Francisco.

turns.speaker: SCRIMM
turns.text: Beautiful city. Used to be, anyway. I didn't think anyone still lived there.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: There's a few of us left.

turns.speaker: SCRIMM
turns.text: That was a pretty clever trick you did with the hospital's batteries. How'd you do it?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: It wasn't a trick. I used to be an electrical engineer.

turns.speaker: SCRIMM
turns.text: Huh.

turns.speaker: SCRIMM
turns.text: And what were you doing out at the missile silo?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I'm an old friend of Cochrane's... I wanted to see how he was doing.

turns.speaker: SCRIMM
turns.text: Lucky for him you came by when you did. He might be dead now.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SCRIMM
turns.text: Maybe you can tell me what he's been doing in that silo. We heard some explosions out there this morning...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I think he was running a test on an old rocket engine... and one of the fuel cells burst.

turns.speaker: SCRIMM
turns.text: You seem to have an answer for everything.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Something wrong with that?

turns.speaker: SCRIMM
turns.text: Not yet.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: SCRIMM
turns.text: The invasion plans.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Invasion.

turns.speaker: SCRIMM
turns.text: These people you're calling "Vulcans"... who are they? Where do they come from? How many troops? What kind of weapons?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: There is no invasion...

turns.speaker: SCRIMM
turns.text: Wrong answer, Mister Picard. Try again.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: From another planet.  Oh, I almost forgot... they have green blood and pointed ears.

turns.speaker: SCRIMM
turns.text: And you know all this... because <U>you're</U> a space-man too...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I'm afraid you've caught me. I am a space-man.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: Take care of him. He's a very special man.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Yes, he is.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: What are you, an idiot? Didn't you see the red light was on?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Ah... yes... but, I didn't realize that --

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: Thank God this plate was already fixed.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Cochrane?

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: Yes... and I only had enough silver halide for one shot. So you're lucky you didn't screw it up.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I'm very sorry.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: Did you need something?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Yes... I wanted to ask you about some photographs I saw out at the silo. There were three of them... printed on some kind of fabric.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: Bed sheets.  I used my last set of bed sheets to make those prints. Not the best material, but I haven't seen a clean piece of paper in five years.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Did you take any other pictures of the rocket?

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: "Money." So you can get dome money...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I can try.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: You'd have to try real hard. No one's used currency in over ten years. What are you, from another planet?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: No... but sometimes I feel that way.  What I meant was, I'd be willing to trade for the photographs.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: Trade. Okay. The photographs... for a straight answer.  Who are you? And how do you know Zephram?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I'm an old friend... I met him when he was doing his undergraduate work at Cornell back in --

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: 'Fraid not.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: You're lying.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: What makes you say that?

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: You're not someone who lies very easily... so it's obvious when you do... at least to me.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Are you always sucha good judge of character?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Were the two of you... involved?

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: No... not like you and Doctor Crusher used to be.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: How did you know about that?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Ruby... I need to talk to you about those photographs. It's very important.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: I'm sure it is. But it'll have to wait until tomorrow.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: It can't wait until tomorrow...

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: Too bad.  Besides, it'll give you all night to think up a new set of lies.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I'd say you already have.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: Don't flatter yourself. I take pictures of a lot of junk.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: Okay, let's hear it. I'm sure you have a great explanation for why those rocket photos are so important you broke into my house.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: We're trying to repair Doctor Cochrane's ship. It's been damaged and --

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: We?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Myself... and a few other friends of Zephram's.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: Friends from Cornell...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Some.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: Lie. That's one. Keep going.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: A key piece of the ship has been destroyed... and our only hope to reconstruct it is if one of your photographs shows us what it looked like.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: All right. Truth. I believe that one. Why is it so urgent you couldn't wait until morning?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: We have to launch his ship by tomorrow afternoon.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Why are you being so difficult? All I'm asking for is to look at one of the photographs. It'll take five minutes.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: And all I'm asking for is the truth. That would take five minutes.  For all I know, you caused the explosions at the silo... and now you're trying to steal Zephram's ship.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I am not a thief...

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: You're leaving, aren't you?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I have to...

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: Where? And don't tell me San Francisco...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: No. It's a lot further than that.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: It's the future, isn't it? Just like you told Scrimm.  I knew you weren't from around here.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: No... I'm from France.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: I don't care if you're from France or Venus... just take me with you.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: That's impossible.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: This may be hard for you to understand... but I'm duty-bound not to interfere with you, or anyone else here... any more than is absolutely necessary.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: You've been interfering with my life ever since I met you.  Don't stop now.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Signal the Endeavor to fall back. We'll cover them.

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: Aye, sir.

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: Incoming transmission from the Borg.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: On screen.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Life signs?

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: Population... thirty-five billion...  All Borg.

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: Captain...?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: We have to follow them back... repair whatever damage they've done to that time-line.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Track their weapons fire.

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: Western hemisphere... North American continent...

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Port battery, ready sir!

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Fire.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Time travel... they're attempting time travel...  Full power, Mister Data. Worf, quantum torpedoes at my command!

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Aye, sir.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Captain, there are five Borg ships closing in on our position.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Data, set a course for that vortex.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Hull integrity down to thirty percent...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Steady as she goes.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Captain, I've found the Borg Sphere. It's on the far side of the planet...firing at the surface.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Intercept course, full impulse.  Weapons status?

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Phasers are off-line... we have two quantum torpedoes left. But the computer targeting system has been destroyed.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Go to manual.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Target locked!

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Fire!

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Worf, have Doctor Crusher, Mister La Forge and a security team meet me in Transporter Room Three. Civilian clothes.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Aye, sir.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Incoming transmission from Starfleet Command. Admiral Hayes.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Onscreen.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: We're caught in some kind of energy wake from the vortex...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Worf... torpedo... now!

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: They must've done it in the past... they went back and changed history...

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: They did it... they assimilated Earth.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Report.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: We're still in Earth orbit.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: On screen.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Looks like they damaged the silo...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Life signs?

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Can't tell. Long-range bio- sensors are off-line.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Captain?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: In twenty-four hours, Zephram Cochrane is supposed to conduct the very first warp test... from a missile silo in Montana. If I'm right, the Borg were trying to change the course of human history by killing him or destroying his ship.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: And if they succeed, humans won't make First Contact with the Vulcans tomorrow.  As First Officer I should be the one beaming down...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Normally, I would agree. But in this case, the mission requires a certain knowledge of 21st century history. You're many things, Number One, but you're not much of an historian.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Good luck, sir.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I'll keep in contact. You have the Bridge.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Return to our own time?

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Then make it so. Have you determined how to recreate the temporal vortex?

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Yes, sir. But Captain... are we... all going back?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Unless you'd like to stay.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: No, sir.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Casualties are light, Captain. Minor buckling on the port nacelle. Nothing serious.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Incoming message from the Starship Intrepid. Admiral Hayes.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: I have assigned two damage control teams to locate the source of our communication problems. So far, they've had no success.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Assign another team if you need to. I want to re-establish communication with the Captain as soon as possible.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: A ship-wide decompression has been initiated!

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: What the hell is happening, Worf?

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: It appears that someone has taken over the Environmental Control Room.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: We saw at least thirty...and there are twenty-two Enterprise crewmembers reported missing... including Commander Data.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: We'll have to assume they've been assimilated into the Collective.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: To control the Enterprise, they'll have to gain access to one of two locations. Main Engineering... or the Bridge.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: We have to cover both possibilities.  We'll take care of the Bridge. Worf, take your men and seal off Main Engineering. Turn it into a fortress -- nothing gets in.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: What are they doing?

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: They appear to be modifying the deflector dish.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: They're re-routing the deflector power conduits...

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Computer -- thermal enhancement.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: They're connecting the conduits to subspace communications...

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: They're converting the deflector dish into an antennae...

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: We have to stop them from sending that message.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Agreed. Options?

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Destroy the deflector dish.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: You will have to realign the targeting array of the quantum torpedo... and reprogram the warhead for the localized detonation.  There's only one torpedo left...

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: I guess I'd better get it right the first time.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: The Borg will undoubtedly attack. Set phasers to rotating modulation.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Are you alright?

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Just a little queasy...

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Try not to look at the stars... keep your eyes on the ship.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: And Commander, whatever you do... do <U>not</U> vomit in your exo-suit. It would be... unpleasant.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: I'll keep that in mind.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Worf! I'm going to need at least five minutes!

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Understood!

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Report!

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: We've lost Bridge control!

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Emergency override!

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Report.

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: We just lost main power... and we've got Class-Three alerts all over the ship. I'm not sure what's --

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: Someone...?

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: The Borg.  Some of them must've beamed over before we destroyed their ship.  Seal off that entire deck with emergency force fields.

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: Wil... Data was down there.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Mister Worf... find Data if you can, but your top priority is isolating the Borg.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: All right... we've lost control of eight decks... three Cargo Bays... one Shuttlebay.

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: Do we have any idea how many Borg we're dealing with?

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: They're bypassing Engineering...

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Where the hell are they going?

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: To do what? If they wanted a weapon, they could've taken over a phaser bank or torpedo bay...

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Deflector dish... why the deflector dish...?

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: I remember it made me sick.

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: What are you suggesting?

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: I think Mister Worf is suggesting that we go outside for a little stroll...

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: I have to admit there was a moment there when --

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Hold that thought.
